MemFormat::MemFormat (  Device *  pDev,
size_t  maxBuf = 256
) 
 

Create a utility that performs byte/short/long read/writes to memory. Formatting for output is done correctly.

Parameters:
pDev device class used for actual register reads and writes
maxBuf maximum number of bytes that can be read at one time

Member Function Documentation

bool MemFormat::doCmd (  char *  cmdStr,
string &  results
) 
 

Parse a text command and perform the memory access/display operation. The command can specify reading memory or writing memory. The command has the syntax: r(b|s|l) <address> (<count>) w(b|s|l) <address> data0 (data1 ...)

The text command allows calling from a menu-like program or passing the command string from a GUI written in a different language (VisualBasic, Java, Python, etc). Results of executing the command are returned in a string (C++ object). The command is not sent to stdout. This allows the command results to be handled as needed by the caller (print to screen, send to a GUI, etc).

Parameters:
cmdStr the null terminated text string containing the command to execute
results the C++ string object to return the results of the command in

bool MemFormat::formatBlockOfBytes (  string &  ostr,
uint32_t  startAddr,
uint32_t  len,
uint8_t *  data
)  [static]
 

Format a buffer of 8 bit values (bytes) into a displayable text string.

0000: 0x55 0x66 0x77 0010: 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0

Parameters:
ostr the caller supplied string to return the formatted bytes in
startAddr the starting address of the data, used in address field of format
len the number of bytes to format
data the array of bytes to process
Returns:
true if successful, false if error encountered
